In-Class Exercise 8

in-class exercise

Visualize network graph data with R.

Author
Affiliation
Liang Minghao

SMU, MITB

Published

March 11, 2023

Load Packages

pacman::p_load(igraph, tidygraph, ggraph, 
               visNetwork, lubridate, clock,
               tidyverse, graphlayouts)

Load Data

GAStech_nodes <- read_csv("/Users/minghaooo/mtlmh34/ISSS608-VAA-mh/Data/s8/GAStech_email_node.csv")

Data Preprocessing

GAStech_edges <- GAStech_edges %>%
  mutate(SendDate = dmy(SentDate)) %>%     #set datatype of SentDate to Date
  mutate(Weekday = wday(SentDate,          #extract days in a week
                        label = TRUE,
                        abbr = FALSE))

# aggreate number of emails between 2 nodes on each weekday
GAStech_edges_aggregated <- GAStech_edges %>%
  filter(MainSubject == "Work related") %>%
  group_by(source, target, Weekday) %>%
    summarise(Weight = n()) %>%
  filter(source!=target) %>%
  filter(Weight > 1) %>%
  ungroup()
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'source', 'target'. You can override using
the `.groups` argument.

Create Graph

GAStech_graph <- tbl_graph(nodes = GAStech_nodes,
                           edges = GAStech_edges_aggregated, 
                           directed = TRUE)
GAStech_graph
